property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Local Afghans hosting U.S. service members

note.text: Homes are always prepared for guests and it's common for hosts to give guests a small gift.

Anyone invited to an Afghan home can expect to be served the host’s best food and tea, even if it is a financial hardship for them. It’s okay to politely decline food on initial offer, but if your host insists, it is rude to continue to refuse.
It’s best to eat slowly, as your plate will be refilled continually.
